text.p: These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Macedonian government proposes new law on employment and social security. Workers from bankrupt companies will have right to welfare benefits for 18 instead of the previous 24 months.

- Students from teachers academy on hunger strike for sixth day outside parliament. Four students hospitalised on Sunday. Pilot issue of student newspaper David and Goliath printed on Sunday to inform Macedonian public about the student demonstrations.

- Financial affair over the TAT savings bank in Bitola raises many questions. Macedonian National Bank governor Borko Stanoevski blamed for the loss of some 100 million German marks. -- Mircela Casule, Skopje Newsroom +389 91 201 196
